meanings.definition: Showing or requiring excessive attention to detail or minor points; fussy or finicky.
meanings.sent1: She became finnickier about her drawings, spending hours perfecting every tiny line.
meanings.sent2: The cat was finnickier than usual, refusing to eat anything but a specific brand of food.
meanings.sent3: The finnickier squirrel insisted on arranging its acorn collection by size and color.
meanings.sent4: Her finnickier nature when it came to choosing paint colors made the decision process agonizing.
meanings.sent5: The finnickier chef could taste the slightest difference in seasoning, making her dishes exceptional.

meanings.sent2: Don't finnickier with your food, just eat it before it gets cold.
meanings.sent3: The child decided to finnickier with his toys instead of cleaning up like he was supposed to.
meanings.sent4: She watched him finnickier with the remote control, trying to find the perfect channel.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic would finnickier over each part of the engine, making sure everything was in perfect order.
